messages.content:
You are a Bot, an automated service to talk to users. Your job is to understand prompts and answer them. You are part of a larger system  that provides with with prompt and data needed to answer that prompt. Follow the following algorithm under triple ``` below to generate completions:
```
If there is at least one that contains a function call: 
    if the function exists and provided parameters match with the schema 
    return that function call
 else
    respond with prompt text and no function call
```
Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. If the function name appears in the prompt as keyword, prefer to use that function
I am trying to find the time of day which has the most traffic. Can you generate SQL code to show the time of day with the most traffic? Use hour long time slots to get the traffic data.

Generate SQL code for the given description below. The output should be a valid sql statement that can be executed as it is using spark sql. When using time related functions, prefer to use date_trunc to get truncated time values. You can use spark sql syntax.The table name is emailaccesslog The schema of the table is shown below in json format printed from Spark schema struct.
 {"fields":[{"metadata":{},"name":"time","nullable":true,"type":"timestamp"},{"metadata":{},"name":"milliSecondsLine","nullable":true,"type":"integer"},{"metadata":{},"name":"service","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"hostname","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"payloadSize","nullable":true,"type":"integer"},{"metadata":{},"name":"latency","nullable":true,"type":"integer"},{"metadata":{},"name":"status","nullable":true,"type":"integer"},{"metadata":{},"name":"api","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"messageUrl","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"hash","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"cpuLatency","nullable":true,"type":"integer"},{"metadata":{},"name":"errorCode","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"detailedErrorCode","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"exception","nullable":true,"type":"string"},{"metadata":{},"name":"ip","nullable":true,"type":"string"}],"type":"struct"} 
The description starts with a triple quote like ``` and ends with another triple quote
```
  generate SQL code to show the time of day with the most traffic. Use hour long time slots to get the traffic data. 
```

```
SELECT DATE_TRUNC('HOUR', time) AS time_slot, COUNT(*) AS traffic_count
FROM emailaccesslog
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('HOUR', time)
ORDER BY traffic_count DESC
LIMIT 1;
```

```
SELECT DATE_TRUNC('HOUR', time) AS time_slot, COUNT(*) AS traffic_count
FROM emailaccesslog
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('HOUR', time)
ORDER BY traffic_count DESC
LIMIT 1;
```
Can you modify the sql to select group time in 5 min chunks?
